creatures

Class PathMemory

  • java.lang.Object
    • creatures.PathMemory

  • public class PathMemory
extends java.lang.Object
    The PathMemory class holds various positions and positions taken from that position, in other words connections.

    Various methods exist to determine the adequacy of a certain direction or position in relation to previously stored/removed connections.

    If the user would like to only use positions which has not been fully explored i.e., has not been approached to/ departed from from all possible directions, then the positionExplored method will be of use.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alexander Beliaev

      Returns the direction of the next backtracking position.
      PathTile.Direction getBackTrackDirection(Position position)
      Returns the direction of the next backtracking position with a specific position in consideration.
      Position getMostRecentCrossing()
      Returns the position of the most recently visited crossing i.e., a position with more than 2 connections.
      boolean isValidDirection(Position position, PathTile.Direction dir)
      Checks whether or not a certain direction from a given position is valid.
      boolean positionExplored(Position position)
      Checks if a position has been visited from all possible directions.
      void rememberBackTrackDirection(Position position, PathTile.Direction dirFrom)
      Adds a position in conjunction with a direction to be remembered in the case of when backtracking is necessary.
      void removeDirection(Position position, PathTile.Direction dir)
      Removes a direction in conjunction with a direction.
      void setMostRecentCrossing(ConnectedPositions conPos)
      Sets the most recently visited ConnectedPositions, i.e., the position with more than 2 connections.

      • addPosition

        public boolean addPosition(Position position,
                           ConnectedPositions conPos,
                           PathTile.Direction dirFrom)
        Adds a position which is associated with the connected positions conPos and the direction it was approached from.
        Parameters:
        position - the position.
        conPos - a ConnectedPositions instance.
        dirFrom - a Direction.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the position has not been added, false otherwise.

      • rememberBackTrackDirection

        public void rememberBackTrackDirection(Position position,
                                       PathTile.Direction dirFrom)
        Adds a position in conjunction with a direction to be remembered in the case of when backtracking is necessary.
        Parameters:
        position - the Position to be remembered.
        dirFrom - a Direction.

      • removeDirection

        public void removeDirection(Position position,
                            PathTile.Direction dir)
        Removes a direction in conjunction with a direction. This method may be called if certain directions from a certain position is not to be visited again.
        Parameters:
        position - the position.
        dir - a Direction.

      • isValidDirection

        public boolean isValidDirection(Position position,
                                PathTile.Direction dir)
        Checks whether or not a certain direction from a given position is valid.
        Parameters:
        position - the position.
        dir - a Direction.
        Returns:
        true if and only if a connection exists with the given parameters, false otherwise.

      • positionExplored

        public boolean positionExplored(Position position)
        Checks if a position has been visited from all possible directions.
        Parameters:
        position - the position.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the position still has connections which has yet not been visited, false otherwise.
